hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Add CRM field mapping auto-discovery and mapping suggestions during setup.docx

sections.text:
This feature adds a new onboarding step that automatically scans a customer’s connected CRM to identify standard and commonly used opportunity/account fields (e.g., stage, close date, amount, owner, last activity). Based on what it finds, Sales_Accelerator will propose default mappings into our canonical schema so customers don’t need to start from a blank slate.

During setup, users will see suggested mappings with a clear confidence indicator for each field. They can quickly accept a suggestion, edit it (choose a different CRM field), or skip it before saving—making the experience fast for straightforward cases while still safe and controllable for edge cases or custom CRM configurations.

The primary impact is reduced time-to-value and fewer setup errors. Auto-discovery and suggestions eliminate much of the manual “hunt and map” work that slows onboarding today, and confidence cues help users trust the system while catching mismatches early.

This step also establishes critical data foundations for downstream product value. Accurate mappings enable benchmarks, stage-based guidance, and activity-driven insights in later setup steps and ongoing usage, improving the reliability of recommendations and reporting across the product.
